t: Joy in the Fellowship of God
A Psalm of David when he was in the wilderness of Judah.
O*pn God, You are*i my God; Early*ld will I seek You; My*ld soul thirsts for You; My*ld flesh longs for You In*ld a dry and thirsty land Where*ld there is no water.
So*ld I have looked for You in the sanctuary, To*ld see Your power and Your glory.
Because*ln Your lovingkindness is*i better than life, My*ld lips shall praise You.
Thus*ld I will bless You while I live; I*ld will lift up my hands in Your name.
My*ld soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness, And*ld my mouth shall praise You*i with joyful lips.
When*ln I remember You on my bed, I*ld meditate on You in the night*i watches.
Because*ld You have been my help, Therefore*ld in the shadow of Your wings I will rejoice.
My*ld soul follows close behind You; Your*ld right hand upholds me.
But*ln those who*i seek my life, to destroy it,*i Shall*ld go into the lower parts of the earth.
They*ld shall fall by the sword; They*ld shall be a portion for jackals.
But*ln the king shall rejoice in God; Everyone*ld who swears by Him shall glory; But*ld the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.
